snippet: Though the law that raised the tax rate expired on Nov. 30, many hotels are still collecting the higher rate because Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg has asked the City Council to reinstate the measure.
abstract: Many New York City hotels seem to have been collecting higher expired tax rate because Mayor Michael R Bloomberg has asked City Council to reinstate measure; city's finance department has changed its Web site to reflect lower rate after receiving inquiry about discrepancy which had visitors unknowingly paying thousands of dollars more in taxes than they should have.
lead_paragraph: Though the law that raised the tax rate expired on Nov. 30, many hotels are still collecting the higher rate because Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg has asked the City Council to reinstate the measure.

headline.main: Expiration of Hotel Room-Tax Rate in New York City Causes Confusion
headline.print_headline: Expiration Of Tax Rate Leads Hotels To Overcharge
